name: lammps-montecarlo
title: 2D Hex Lattice: Monte Carlo Relaxation Simulation
description: This app performs Monte Carlo relaxation of a perturbed 2D hexagonal lattice using LAMMPS. The simulation creates a perfect 2D hex lattice, introduces disorder through random perturbations, then uses Monte Carlo moves with Boltzmann acceptance criteria to relax the system to lower energy states.
content:
Overview

This application demonstrates Monte Carlo (MC) relaxation using LAMMPS as an energy evaluation engine. The simulation creates a perfect 2D hexagonal lattice, introduces disorder, then uses Metropolis Monte Carlo to relax the system to lower energy states.

Scientific Relevance

Monte Carlo methods are fundamental to statistical mechanics and materials science. This simulation demonstrates energy landscape exploration, thermal acceptance criteria, and lattice relaxation mechanisms. The Boltzmann factor governs move acceptance, providing insights into equilibrium sampling and defect annealing processes.

Simulation Process

  • System: 100 atoms in 2D hexagonal lattice with Lennard-Jones interactions

  • Algorithm: Single-atom displacement moves with energy-based acceptance/rejection

  • Physics: Metropolis criterion using Boltzmann factor exp(-Î”E/kT)

Expected Results

The system should relax from high initial energy (~20 LJ units) to lower final energy (~-2.7 LJ units), approaching the minimum lattice energy (-2.99 LJ units). Typical acceptance rates range from 15-20% depending on temperature and move size parameters.

Job Validation

Successfully validated with Job 3212: 1-second execution time, energy relaxation from 19.88 to -2.76 LJ units, 488 accepted moves out of 3000 attempts (16.3% acceptance rate), performance metrics within expected ranges.
